thread.title: Which Connecticut Town Sends The Most Runners To The Hartford Marathon?
thread.title_full: Which Connecticut Town Sends The Most Runners To The Hartford Marathon? - Hartford Courant

author: courant.com
title: Which Connecticut Town Sends The Most Runners To The Hartford Marathon?
text:
Eighty-five runners from West Hartford competed in the Hartford Marathon last year, more than any other town in the state.
In 2013, West Hartford sent 95 runners.
Glastonbury, with 41 runners in 2014, came in second. More than 1,200 Connecticut runners finished the marathon last year, down about 90 from 2013.
But one thing has stayed consistent: The average Connecticut runner in both of the last two years was 38.67 years old.
West Hartford's runners account for about 0.13 percent of its population, so people who didn't have the motivation to run last year are in good company. But that percentage is still one of the highest percentages in the state.
Among all towns that sent at least 10 runners to the Hartford Marathon last year, Middlebury sent the greatest percentage (0.16 percent) of its population.
SOURCE: Hartford Marathon Foundation, CoolRunning.com Copyright Â© 2015, Hartford Courant
